snippet: The Saudis are bent on ousting Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, and his patron, Iran. But their only real means of fighting them is through a proxy war using fighters over whom they have almost no control.
abstract: Saudi Arabia's rulers are bent on ousting Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, and his patron, Iran, but their only real means of fighting them is through proxy war using Syrian rebels over whom they have almost no control; Saudis are finding they have limited sway over the zealot militia fighters, many of whom are Islamists whose creed is often scarcely separable from Al Qaeda's.
lead_paragraph: The Saudis are bent on ousting Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, and his patron, Iran. But their only real means of fighting them is through a proxy war using fighters over whom they have almost no control.

headline.main: Saudis Back Syrian Rebels Despite Risks
headline.print_headline: Saudis Back Syrian Rebels Despite Risks
